website_summaries.verdict: For a throw that looks as good as it feels, go with this woven cotton throw.
pros: A 100% cotton throw blanket with a waffle pattern
This is a great choice for a bed or as a couch cover
cons: Not as soft as a fleece throw blanket due to 100% cotton material

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this has such great reviews.... it’s stiff, hard and smells like chemicals! Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Size up!  Very pretty blanket for warm weather and a layer for cold
customer_reviews.text: I have a very thick full size mattress in the guest room. I purchased a King which drapes over the sides like a bedspread. I wanted a usable blanket, not a decorative throw and this is it! It's a heavy weight cotton in a simple knit pattern. I machine washed on cold, gentle, and dried on low. No wrinkles. I didn't measure for shrinkage but I can say it's not misshapen. In winter I'll add more pretty blankets. So tired of hauling comforters to the laundromat and coming back to the same tired pattern, etc. This cotton blanket is so versatile!
customer_reviews.author: mdc

customer_reviews.title: this is like no other cotton product i have ever had it ...
customer_reviews.text: this is like no other cotton product i have ever had it came in and smelled real bad i washed it 3 times in a row it is still stiff and scratchy not soft and comfortable at all would send it back but have washed it
customer_reviews.author: Hal Ritchie

customer_reviews.text: I love this blanket. It is of very good quality, the size perfect. It is not "flimsy" at all. I live in Arizona and need a lightweight blanket in the summer. I washed and dried it before using and it had very little shrinkage if any at all.
customer_reviews.author: bj

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This blanket feels like it is actually polyester not cotton. It's scratchy and hasn't soften with a few washes. I don't agree with other reviewers who say it is stiff because it is cotton. I've had other 100% organic cotton blankets that we're soft and pliable from day 1, however, those blankets cost a bunch more. So, I think this is a case of "you get what you pay for". So, considering the price and the fact it is cotton, I'm giving it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Buy a King for good coverage on a Queen sized bed
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews, I got a king sized blanket for my queen sized bed and am very pleased with it. Most twin/queen sized blankets son't offer enough coverage. Especially if you have two people sleeping in the bed. Unless they are glued together, the outside edge will not have good blanket coverage. But the king size provides for plenty of side coverage without hanging down onto the floor. Nice woven cotton blanket adds a comfy layer between sheets and bedspread for year round comfort. Good color. Quality product. Not super lightweight, which I liked. Doesn't shed too much lint in the dryer. All cottons shed some but it's not filling my dryer screen with each wash or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: K. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To blanket
customer_reviews.text: I'm a type of person that needs a blanket over my body in order to fall asleep comfortably. Its hard when you have to adjust to the weather. This is the most consistent blanket that I use on cold and hot days. This is basically my go-to blanket if anything, but everyone is different. I think its pretty cood in trapping in heat as well as letting cool air in. It really depends whether you put this over or under another blanket.
customer_reviews.author: BigTangTheory

customer_reviews.title: Gave me terrible allergies, rough material, and shrinks
customer_reviews.text: It took me a month to figure out why I was sneezing every morning, but I realized it was this blanket after some trial and error. Definitely something in here other than cotton. Unfortunately it’s now past the return window. Also rough material and shrunk significantly after washing it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Matisek

customer_reviews.title: Material feels really weird.
customer_reviews.text: The material feels really weird, thus making it uncomfortable and I am really sad because now I don't want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Nyooni

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy and not pliable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very attractive blanket however, it is so heavy. It is not soft at all. I find that after about 20 minutes I have to toss it off me because of the heavy and stiffness of it. I would not buy it again. I would also like to return it because of the reasons I mentioned. Thank you, Sandra Benezra
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this blanket. I am a very hot sleeper and this is perfect. It provides some warmth but not too much. It was some weight too it but not overwhelmingly. The size is great. I will be buying more of these. Some people did compare this to a hospital blanket, I wouldn’t disagree, but I love the feel of hospital blankets. It’s not soft like what comes to mind with cotton but it is super comfy. The perfect blanket for me.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Whitecotton

customer_reviews.title: Is your blanket as thick as a tablecloth?
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item a 1 for four reasons. 1. The "blanket" was the thickness of a tablecloth. It was very, very thin. 2. The "blanket" shrunk significantly when it was washed. After washing it, the blanket hung of the edge by maybe 3 inches on either side of our California king bed. There was nothing to tuck-in on the sides. 3. The instructions were incomplete. 4. It was not soft when it arrived and after a washing it was still not soft. I did like the square pattern design. But as a blanket, it was more like a sheet. I think a flannel sheet would keep you warmer.
customer_reviews.author: jim pickrell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cotton blanket.
customer_reviews.text: I have already purchased three of these blankets and plan on getting more. They are 100% cotton with a tight weave and a perfect weight. I bought the first one to cover a couch for my dog, who is allergic to synthetic fabrics. The tight weave prevents her skin from touching anything synthetic underneath. I ended up buying more for her and also one for my own bed. Very handy to have some extras on hand, too, for extra warmth, backups, or blanket fort emergencies. I really love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with this blanket
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of this thermal blanket. I currently have a twin size & now a double/queen size! Love the weight and warmth it provides! Quality is perfect with nicely finished edges. Stays on the bed unlike the plush Velour blankets that tend to shift and bunch up. Washes & drys beautifully! My twin blanket is used on a massage table and is washed after each client and still looks like new after 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Blanket
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this blanket, this is my second purchase. It's excellent for the summer months. Lovely color, nice simple weave, great texture, and excellent size. It fits perfect with the furnishings and colors in my guest bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Williams

customer_reviews.title: Horrible blanket!!
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is awful. DO NOT BUY IT! It feels like it was dipped in wax or straight up plastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my temperature issues.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it's been in the 50s and 60s temperature wise and my big comforter is too hot. Obviously too cold still for the ac, I'm one of those weirdos who has to have a blanket to sleep. Googled good blankets for such a problem. I've never had a blanket like this before and I'm so happy with it. One night I got cold and threw the comforter on over top and I wasn't even too hot then either. It's also perfect on the couch too. It is soft but not soft like fleece etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Butt-Ugly, but a Good Blanket
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Sage Green blanket, and expected the color shown on the product page. It's actually brighter, somewhere between a 1980s Yoda action figure and an under-ripe lemon. But despite that, it's a good blanket. It's thin, but fairly weighty. It covers without adding too much warmth. And it breathes, so you don't overheat. It's perfect for adding just a bit more cover in the spring and summer. Just don't get the green one.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Bonobo

customer_reviews.title: Not really a thermal blanket but good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is not soft but it is not scratchy. It is like a heavy, thick cotton sheet. This is not as warm as a soft thermal blanket but it will make a nice top during the summer. There was very little shrinkage. The color did not bleed in the wash. There wasn't a lot of fiber in the lint trap. Actually there was no more than normal. When I was a child in the 60's all my friends had blanket like this and used them for a bedspread. I don't think it could snag easily unless you let your dog or cat play on the bed and their claws catch it.
customer_reviews.author: SWoods

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: My husband always doubted my bedding skill until after this purchase! I bought the king after reading so many poor reviews about shrinking, and while we love the size on our queen bed, we actually didn't experience any shrinkage after wash! My husband loves the feel of it, perfect for Florida weather, and a great additive to our bed! We had a chunky blanket before that was just ugly and I hated and I knew I could find a slimmer looking blanket that would offer the same temperature he wanted and BAM! did it (: We did the green but we will be purchasing more in future
customer_reviews.author: Emily Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad at all
customer_reviews.text: More of a bedspread than a blanket. The material reminds me of a light weight denim type of fabric. Not all that soft, hemmed on two sides and unfinished on the other two, but washes well. Color is darker than pictured but looks good nonetheless. Works for my purpose of layering with another light weight blanket in the winter. During the summer this should be ideal with just the top sheet. Overall I'm happy and for the price it was hard to pass up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great Blanket and Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Update: after I left my initial review, Utopia contacted me and offered to send a replacement blanket at no cost to me. Great customer service! We determined that the packaging was mislabeled, and I'd received the twin size initially in error. Definitely a warehouse issue, not a product issue. Love the blanket!! Not thrilled about this blanket...I like the pattern and color, but the sizing is way off. More like a twin than king.the bottom of the blanket falls right at the edge of mattress and top edge comes to just below pillows, with about 4" overhang on either side of bed. If the sizing were accurate, I'd have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen E

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: True to the pictures. It is light weight but not thin. I bought this as a summer blanket instead of a comforter. I washed if by itself as soon as it came and it does make a lot of lint! Over I'm happy so far. I will probably continue to use this as a layering blanket over the winter. I ordered the purple and it's true to color.
customer_reviews.author: Camanda

customer_reviews.title: Very nice blanket
customer_reviews.text: When I received my full/queen blanket I washed as instructed. Small amount of lint and did not seem to shrink much. Although I didn't measure - fits bed perfectly. Is a very nice thermal light weight blanket. Very well made for everyday or night as the case may be. I will for sure be ordering another one just to have on hand. Price is excellent - I did a lot of research before making my choice. I believe this is the best one - for my preference anyway.... if you looking I say go for it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: How did this get so many good reviews
customer_reviews.text: Cotton is a natural fiber and is super easy to dye. How the heck did they screw it up? If it wasn't for the "bleach" looking stains, I would have given the blankets (I purchased 2 king) a go. Cotton is usually stiff when new and gets softer with use. These blankets where stiffer than normal. Leading me to believe they were heavily treated with a preservative before storing or they didn't wash them after dying. But even after washing (per the products instructions) they were still stiff and one had shrunk in a weird way. A good manufacturer would have washed after dying to ensure the products did not shrink or have any dye flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Rose

customer_reviews.title: I love this blanket!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this blanket!! If you want a soft fuzzy blanket you won't get that with this one. But you will get a high quality blanket that is nice, soft, warm cotton blanket. It can also be used in the summer months and not to warm or thick. My parents and grandparents had blankets like this and I still have one of my mother's that I use but it's too small for my bed unfortunately. Will last you for generations!
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight, rich grey color with a tight weave..... Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: My husband requested a cotton blanket for our bed so we could fold our quilt back during the hot summers in Texas. I ordered this quickly off my phone just before I went to bed. This blanket is nicely built. The weave is tight enough that I think there won't be a snagging problem like our previous cotton blanket. The color is a nice deep/dark grey. The weight of the blanket is decent and not too heavy or too light. It lays nicely on the bed and covers the bed well. I am glad I chose this blanket rather than heading out to Walmart in the morning to look for one.
customer_reviews.author: J Moochie

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but notsoft
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is good for a couch throw or end of bed more decorative blanket. It's a looser weave, you can see light through it and it's not incredibly soft. I was hoping for softer. I'm going to keep it though to go on a couch. For the price it's ok, but not what I wanted for daily use on a bed. I would highly recommend Target's liquid cotton blanket if you're looking for softness AND durability. This one isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Justine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even really deserve 1 star. It's rough n ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't even really deserve 1 star. It's rough n stiff. Also had quite a few snags on it when I received it
customer_reviews.author: Dawna Rae

customer_reviews.title: 100% Cotton Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I love this cotton blanket. It washes and dries beautifully leaving no pills or lint on the fabric. I like my bedding to be all cotton for comfort. I would not say this blanket is 'soft and cozy'; in fact, I'd say it's thick and sturdy (but not scratchy). It is 100% cotton and breathable. Keeps me warm but not hot. This is a great blanket but it is also hefty enough to serve as a bedspread. The blanket has a nice ornamental weave so it is also visually pleasing. I recommend this blanket to anyone. Especially those who prefer natural fibers.
customer_reviews.author: DeLorus Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great color and texture for a Hospital Blanket
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get this for my wife and she loves her blanket. This blanket is perfect for those cold nights and hot nights. It is not one of those blankets that make you sweat while covered in them like a cocoon. In fact, it is very opened and comfortable, almost like a breeze like fairness to it. Definitely recommend this blanket, I got it in the dark gray color. Looks really good and it will take sometime to get it to that cozy feel after a couple of washes. My white one is super soft but then again I have had it for more than 10 years and still feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos R

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks more with every wash
customer_reviews.text: This type of blanket is never very soft, so people who gave it a bad rating probably didn't understand what they were buying. It's relatively soft for this type of blanket, but it's so a fluffy furry kind of soft. It holds up well to frequent washing and is cool to sleep under in the hot summer. UPDATE: This king-sized blanket has shrunken to the point that it's too small for my queen-sized bed. It's too short now. I barely tuck it in at the foot, and it doesn't reach my shoulders. The shrinking just never stops; it gets worse every week when I wash and dry it. Gotta replace it already, and I'll buy one that's preshrunk this time.
customer_reviews.author: shopper489

customer_reviews.title: Really Good TRUE COTTON
customer_reviews.text: Item was exactly as described, no issues whatsoever. It's REAL COTTON, so it's not super soft (other reviews have said "scratchy," but that sounds too negative to describe it), and it's not the warmest, but that's all good! It's supposed to be a little stiffer and a little lighter, that's the whole point of cotton.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ok, won't lie. You can find a better quality blanket, BUT you will may a lot more than this for it. I am SO pleasantly surprised. Out of the package it is stiff and the white color is a kind of bleachy white, but it washed to a nice softness and a softer hue as well. I'm delighted. I bought 2 of these to be quick throw-overs to protect a pair of matching couches from our dog. But they look really good, and with a few fun decorative pillows, I now keep them on all the time. Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Like a hospital blanket
customer_reviews.text: I bought these blankets to layer with a comforter I guest room. I viewed them on amazon and thought they would be okay. Well they are just okay if you want to bring back memories of hospital stays. I was forced to keep them because company was coming and had no choice. The quality was okay but definitely not what I saw in picture and definitely not the feeling I wanting to convey to my guest. If you are looking too relive a recent hospital this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: We've finally found the best blanket!
customer_reviews.text: We love this cotton blanket! We're picky about our bedding because we both get hot easily. Some cotton blankets have been too heavy. We've used this blanket it for two weeks now, and it's perfect. We've been layering it under our comforter for a little more warmth, and it adds some weight, but does not get too hot. The pattern is a tightly woven cross hatch. It's 100 % cotton and breathes. We've had no problem with lint. Nor do we find it rough. In fact, after only a small amount of use, it's become very soft. Perfect for layering in cooler months or alone in summer. We're getting another for guests.
customer_reviews.author: jennscomm

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bright white blanket
customer_reviews.text: I love this blanket. I have used it on my bed every night since I got it. It’s textured in places so it’s pretty rather than just a plain white blanket. It’s soft and not too heavy. Good for the warmer weather. It gets cold here in winter when I will change my bedding out for flannel sheets a wool blanket and a comforter as opposed to cotton sheets this blanket and a quilt. And it stays bright white after washing. No yellowing or a dull gray. Comfortable bedclothes are important.
customer_reviews.author: Carin

customer_reviews.title: Thin enough for summer nights yet thick enough to feel substantial
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Bought three: a twin for a twin bed, another twin as a throw for tv watching and a full for a full bed. It manages to be thin and thick at the same time! It is thin enough to serve as a single cover for hot summer nights and a cover when sitting on the couch yet thick enough to feel substantial - due to all that "ribbing". The fact that it is 100% cotton ensures breathing so you don't get sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: Nur Allen

customer_reviews.title: Very light and good for california summers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get something for summers in california. It gets pretty warm and I was not able to survive in any normal blanket we find on walmart because they all seemed too heavy/thick. This one has the right balance. However, the texture printed makes it slightly less soft and hence the three stars. Not sure how well it would hold for folks outside california though.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Cotton? No way!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this purple blanket for a butterfly themed room that I am doing for my granddaughter. 4500 plus reviews, over 4.5 stars, under $30 and 100% cotton. I was thrilled. When I opened it, I thought geez it seems hard. I assumed it would soften after a good washing and drying. This blanket....if you can call it that is the hardest blanket I have ever had the misfortune of owning. I feel bad having washed it. But this blanket is being placed back in its original packaging and sent back to Amazon to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: KSanders

customer_reviews.title: King Size fits a Tall Queen
customer_reviews.text: I have a queen bed with pillow topper, and this blanket fits it very well with extra fabric draped over the sides. It stunk when I first bought it, but that was fixed with a hot washing cycle (which also shrunk it down to the perfect, oversized Queen blanket I needed). One problem: it creates a ton of lint when washing, so wash it alone. I really enjoy how warm and soft it is, plus its surprisingly heavy for such a thin blanket. It's perfect to add to my winter bedding set.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gross

customer_reviews.title: Most definitely a hospital blanket but that’s okay
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a blanket that I could use in the summertime in the AC without making me sweat. I saw that this was similar to a hospital blanket and those things generally suck at keeping me warm, so I bought it. It is indeed exactly like a hospital blanket but the quality is much better. Out of the packaging it was a bit stiff and smelled like plastic so I gave it a wash. It held up just fine in both washer/dryer; fabric softener did the trick for stiffness.
customer_reviews.author: 420blazeit

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I washed the blanket before use. It faded from a dark gray to a weird orange-ish pink. The stitched seams have to be put side to side instead if head to foot. It feels like cotton and is not soft. It is of a good weight for cooler weather. The photo attached shows the color change. Although this is just ONE section. It is covered in the same color in different sections of the blanket. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Best Granmomma

customer_reviews.title: Nice color but...
customer_reviews.text: The color is nice, and it is just the perfect weight for warm weather sleeping. But my blanket has several pulls in the weave. Threads look like they have been snagged on something and are sticking out of the weave of the blanket. It has not been washed yet, and when I do I am afraid that it will come further unraveled. I would have sent it back, but it sat in its packaging for over a month. Shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Firestone

customer_reviews.title: Am I being punked? These reviews must be for a different blanket than I received.
customer_reviews.text: Am I being punked or what? This blanket is not even close to being soft. Why all the raving reviews? It stunk horribly and although the stench vanished within a few washes, it’s still not soft. I tried 3 times to wash & dry and It’s still stiff and now is a faded grey color. Even Downey can’t touch this blanket. I ordered three in different colors, grey, white and tan. The white is just as rough and I’ve yet to receive the tan. I’m afraid they’ll all need to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kloser

customer_reviews.title: Well made blanket
customer_reviews.text: I was needing a sheet blanket and this is as close as I could get. It is a bit heavier than a sheet blanket but breathable and so it is no warmer than the sad little flannel flat sheet I was using. After washing and drying once it is still a bit coarser than what I am used to but I imagine it will soften more with subsequent washings. It is a nice weave and looks as though it will last me a good long time. We'll see how warm it keeps me this winter.
customer_reviews.author: good2bqueen

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy cotton
customer_reviews.text: Put this on our bed today after washing it. I love how thick and heavy it is, especially since it’s January. It will be a good stand alone blanket in the summer. We bought the king size for our queen size bed. It hangs down to the top of the box springs. It did clog up my washing machine with the amount of lint it shed in the first wash. The gray is a very dark gray, like a soft black color. The fabric is coarse, hoping it softens over time. We will see how it holds up to cat and dog sleeping on our bed. Great breathable blanket for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Twinmom

customer_reviews.title: Mission accomplished. Just like the blanket my grandma used to have on her bed!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Reminds me of the blankets grandma had. Its not a fluffy soft blanket, thats not what I needed. Durable, has now survived 10+ washes and four dogs and two humans that sleep with this nightly. I wash it every other day or so. *Dog hair comes right off!* Adds perfect warmth/weight for summer sleeping. Highly recommend. I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P

customer_reviews.title: Great breathable blanket
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought - loved it! I was looking for a blanket that was mid weight and breathable. I live in Houston where the winter can go from coldish to warm in a matter of days so I wanted a blanket that was flexible - this one is. I rated it a 3 for softness because its a cotton blend fabric and its not exactly soft but its comfortable; not scratchy at all. It's got a nice weight - not too heavy; not light weight either.
customer_reviews.author: terria

customer_reviews.title: Breathable and weighted, but not.
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is the best. I use it over my flat sheet and it keeps me warm but not hot. If I get cold I simply pull up my quilt. It’s not heavy, but still makes me feel like I have a blanket on me, to give me that comfy feeling. I’ll be ordering more. Definitely worth the price. I washed it on warm water like I would any other blanket and dried it just like I do everything else. It fits my queen bed perfectly. Comparable to a hospital blanket, but much nicer. It is beautiful snowy white and I’d recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Nice blanket but size up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blanket in hopes that it would be like hospital blankets but was a little disappointed. I found that this blanket is a bit heavier and a lot stiffer than the ones in the hospital. It is a good weight and not too hot for Texas weather. I also recommend that you buy a king size for a queen bed, especially if you have a tall mattresses because there was substantial shrinkage. Overall I like the blanket and use it daily, it’s just not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Hunnie '59

customer_reviews.title: Retains body heat
customer_reviews.text: Ordered king size and after tucking in the bottom (so it’s not floating loose over us all night, it only comes up to the top of my torso, so I’d say it’s a little smaller than I’d like. I have also noticed that even with a sheet beneath it to separate it from touching our skin, it retains our body heat and holds it for a good while. I went back to make the bed about 40 minutes after getting out of the bed and the blanket was still a little warm.
customer_reviews.author: GreenvilleMom

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery, light weight with breathable material, color is true to description
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my husband. I think it is not as soft as a towel blanket (that I intended to purchase) but it is not as teriibly rough/stiff as other reviews mentioned. It keeps him warm enough without heavy weight and because the fabric is breathable, it doesn't trap sweat or moist. Color is true to the description. He likes it so far. It has washed once before use so my review is not on its durability (but it seems reasonably knitted well)
customer_reviews.author: Monchacha

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. I really wanted the sage but it was only available in king size but I really like the purple, it's a really pretty color. I agree with one of the other reviewers that the roughness is wildly exaggerated. UPDATE: I really love these blankets so such that I have gotten the green, blue, and grey. I'm not a fan of the green, I think because the purple, blue, and grey are such nice rich colors and the green is a very pale pastel green.
customer_reviews.author: LCM

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've used this blanket every single night since I purchased it. I was looking for something lightweight but cozy that would look nice by itself on my bed and keep me snug on summer nights, while also layering well under a comforter during the winter. This blanket definitely fits the bill. It's nice and soft, and I've also noticed that it snags less easily than others with similar thickness and weave. I have 2 cats, and neither one of them have managed to ruin this bad boy yet, fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Kat H.

customer_reviews.title: Cozy, warm & breathable...no sweating.
customer_reviews.text: 100% thermal cotton; soft as this material can be. It will become softer over time. Layering: Top sheet, blanket & comforter. A great weight. I feel so cozy, like I'm being hugged. Haven't needed a blanket in years, as my old comforter was heavy cotton. My new one is thin polyester & this blanket is perfect! I love quality products from Pakistan & India, as well. Well made, double stitching, no fraying anywhere. Perfectly shaped 90 x 90. Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia55

customer_reviews.title: Executes the basics perfectly, not sure why so many poor reviews
customer_reviews.text: factory packaging was fine, no manufactures defects in the blanket. Definitely does have a "manufacturing" odor to it, but nothing that didn't come out with the first wash. Blanket isn't heavy and won't replace a quilt or a duvet, but its not supposed to, its a blanket. Color has stayed true after a few washings. Over all a great simple cotton blanket.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: If you read the description of the blanket....that is exactly what you get. I needed a breathable blanket to go over my sheet (comforter too hot), as I was waking up either hot or cold....this blanket is exactly that. The color is exactly as shown in the photo (gray) and the care instructions are on the tag (although not exactly the best written). Would recommend if you need more than the sheet, but not as much as the comforter or quilt.
customer_reviews.author: PMD

customer_reviews.title: Easy, breezy, blanket
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for in a summer blanket. I live in South Texas and work nights, so sleeping during the hottest parts of the day was uncomfortable. This blanket provides the weight and comfort I was needing to get a comfortable sleep. It breathes really well and the size fits my king size bed perfectly. Just follow manufacturer washing instructions...if you can understand the broken English and wrong word usage.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Wrong description.
customer_reviews.text: I will keep it although it’s the same thick thin winter blanket I ordered a few months ago under winter blanket. I’m not picky my wife likes it cold at night so I sleep in the twin room from tome to time. One blanket doesn’t do the trick and it got delivered today. It’s thin but ruggedly design. I fear not no more cold nights waking up at 3 in the morning and have to be up by 5:30 In search of something to keep me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Agent 87

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be OK . I just received it a few days ago so it is difficult to rate something that has not been tested in such a short time . I have rated it a TOO HEAVY but I suppose that is because it is cotton which usually is much heavier than synthetic fabrics. Also the temperature has been at an average of 95 degrees or higher and not blanket weather so I won't be able to give much info. at this time .
customer_reviews.author: scaventjos

customer_reviews.title: Great bedding staple
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cal King size in grey. It washed and dried perfectly, did not shrink unevenly like some others we’ve tried, the blanket is flat after washing/drying without weird puckers, the fabric is densely woven, and seems durable. If I had to find a flaw it would be that the grey has a slight green tint to it.
customer_reviews.author: KindaCrunchy

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible blanket
customer_reviews.text: We use these blankets for our dog, who normally tears bedding apart. These hospital blankets were recommended by a friend with the same problem, and they are great - our first one has lasted years with daily use, and I just bought a second which seems to be the same quality as the first. Easy to clean in the washer/dryer. I like the textured pattern, for looks. It's not the softest ever, but softer blankets aren't as sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Hooked for life
customer_reviews.text: Second one of these I’ve bought, I love them! I bought the king size for my queen bed and it fits perfectly, I’m afraid the full/queen probably would leave any room for tucking it in or tugging around as a lot of people do when they sleep. Washes well, produces a lot of lint in the dryer but still comes out fluffy and comfortable. The perfect go between for a sheet and a comforter!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, I just ordered another
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a 2nd one. This breathable cotton blanket has grown on me. I usually prefer soft fleece. But I like the idea of the lightweight breathable cotton. It’s getting softer w each wash. I like that it’s just warm enough w.o the weight and feels so clean.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler blanket
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great blanket for less than 30 dollars. I got my King size Dark Grey blanket for $25 and it was a very good purchase. I washed it prior to use, and after cleaning out a decent amount of lint from the dryer trap I have found no other fuzzies or lint coming off of it. It isn’t lightweight and it isn’t very soft, but I wanted a large more cool feeling blanket as an additional layer with my others. I would highly recommend this blanket
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight blanket for sleeping/ bedding.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what we were looking for for the bed. It goes on top of the sheets, under the comforter or bed spread. It is made of good quality material...cotton. Well made. I read some reviews, yes it did stink. I had to wash it before we could use it. I dried on lower heat so that it would not shrink. We live in the south, so while in the summer you don't want a comforter on you you would like a little more than a sheet. This blanket works nice for that. The size is a good size that does cover our King bed with some length on either side of the edge. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Blanket! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great blanket! I love it! So it wanted me to give a rating for lightweight I hope the low star count doesn’t bring the overall rate down because it’s not a lightweight blanket but it’s not supposed to be and that’s what I love about it!! It did have a little small hole when I got it. But I liked it so much I didn’t want to return it and wait for another or get something else not as good. But it small so it doesn’t bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Katie's Ama

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pull out from end of the king bed
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a 100% cotton king blanket that will stay tucked into the end of our x-long king motion bed. X-long twin fitted sheets are easy enough to find but no such luck with an X-long king blanket. This one stays tucked in and is not too skimpy on the sides either. I would have given it 5 stars except the color is really dark grey (almost black) but it couldn't find one in a lighter grey or medium brown. Love the weight and feel and is heavy enough that it may take up into the winter. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: SE TN shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfection- Year round comfort for a warm climate
customer_reviews.text: I live in AZ and this is a perfect year round blanket. I love everything about it. It is pure white and makes the bed look clean and inviting. It is thin but not flimsy, comfortable and breathable. I like the weave. I wanted a blanket that would give a neat appearance- I ordered a king for a queen bed--It is a little oversized.Great purchase at a good deal price.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent summer blanket
customer_reviews.text: I desperately need a summer blanket. I'm quite pleased with this blanket but I can't help but wish it was softer. I use a sheet underneath, and that helps. I don't know if I'd be comfortable with just the blanket next to my skin. It's fine with the sheet underneath and serves the purpose of a somewhat lightweight cotton blanket. I purchased one for my daughter, and she's pleased with it. It does wash and dry well with hot water, and I haven't noticed any shrinkage at all. It's a very well-sized blanket.
customer_reviews.author: HighHopes

customer_reviews.title: Light blanket, not for the cold winter
customer_reviews.text: Nice blanket. Can't say it's super warm. In fact it feels like a very light blanker. Definitely not for the summer season. So be aware. If you live somewhere in Alaska or Canada it might not be a good choice. Sizing is a bit off. I have full size bed. Blanket itself is bigger so you gotta fold it a little bit on one size.
customer_reviews.author: Kirill V.

customer_reviews.title: Great for warmer weather
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for: - lightweight, but heavy enough to stay in place - breathable - on the crisp side, not super soft or fluffy - bright white - holds its shape after laundering If that’s what you’re looking for, I think you’ll be pleased. If not, I suggest you look for a different blanket. I was so pleased with the first blanket (full/queen) that I ordered another for a twin bed.
customer_reviews.author: Lenoir

customer_reviews.title: Watch for Shrinkage
customer_reviews.text: I would probably not have an issue with this blanket if I bought it to use on my bed. But I put it on the sofa to protect against dog drool and, while it fit perfectly out of the package, it has shrunk 4”-6” in length after washing in cold water and drying on low heat. That said, it’s comfortable to sit on and good-looking, and if it had started a little longer or shrunk less, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We received our queen sized blanket very quickly. I washed and dried it and it came out nicely, not too much lint. It fits on the bed just as described. We like having an extra blanket between the sheet and a winter weight blanket. We slept under this arrangement for the first time last night. It is just what we'd hoped for ~ Just the right weight and doesn't shift around like our old tired, too small blanket. Thank you Utopia for making such a fine product available.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Love this blanket
customer_reviews.text: Love this blanket. Finally figured out that an all cotton blanket prevents me from waking up multiple times a night from being too hot. This is a good weight, not too thick, not to thin, and has a nice pattern and tight weave so my pup's nails don't do damage. The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is a few loose fibers popping up in one spot after pre-washing once on the gentle cycle, not noticeable enough to be a major complaint.
customer_reviews.author: smey

customer_reviews.title: Great blanket, great price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this blanket, I purchased this as well as a 3 piece green blanket set. I wanted this to go over top during the colder nights to add that extra layer of warmth and this will work perfectly. I purchased the green and it is beautiful. The size is great and bigger than I had expected which is great. I am happy with this blanket and it seems like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blanket, Color Fades
customer_reviews.text: For the blanket itself, I like it a lot! Only problem I've had is that the grey acquires these splotches of what looks like semi-bleached areas every time I wash it. I don't use bleach (like ever), so I know it's not from my washing machine. Contemplating straight up tie-dying it to make it look on purpose. Would definitely just get the white next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you’ll love it!
customer_reviews.text: So breathable! I only buy cotton blankets for that reason! I live in Texas so they are nice to layer and easy to throw one off if needed! Very soft, pretty, and I love the pattern! I did however buy one king and one twin and the twin is darker then the king? Not sure about that but it’s no big deal! Love both of them! I attached some pictures!! Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Katie

customer_reviews.title: Breathable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought 2 of them and then ended up buying a 3rd one. I used two to cover my couch from cat and dog hair/dander. The blankets as covers work well and are not too stiff to sit on. After covering my couch I bought the third one for my bed. I live in the south so it's always hot outside making it difficult to keep our house cool. The blanket helps keep me cool at night with the right amount of weight to make you feel cozy.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Leader

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what  I wanted, but barely wide enough for queen bed and shrinks.
customer_reviews.text: Utopia Bedding Premium Cotton Blanket Queen Grey. This is like typical old-school "bedspread" and is durable and comfortable; not too soft or fuzzy like other modern fabrics. Nice blanket for me, I sleep too hot usually and this stays cool. Easy to make warmer with one extra sheet. Queen blanket overhangs 3 to 4 inches on each side of bed....wish it was wider :( I have also purchased a king-size so I can try to shrink it down to queen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Staining
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blanket for our guest bedroom. It's not too thin or very thick, which is perfect as a layering blanket. It came with a dark stain on it like previous reviews have mentioned. So far I've only found a small amount of staining so I'm going to keep it and see if stain remover helps. It's still a big disappointment and I don't plan on purchasing again from this seller since they apparently don't care about quality assurance for their products.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Romaine

customer_reviews.title: Very nice blankey
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this blanket. I have been looking for something that is fairly light yet warm and this for me is it. I washed it as soon as it arrived so can't comment on shrinkage but it fits my queen size bed just fine. It is not soft like a tee shirt but it is not coarse or rough at all. It feels very sturdy and hopefully it will last for years. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes Me Feel Like a Grown Up!
customer_reviews.text: I decided it was time to replace the mismatched bedding I have had since college with something more adult. (Cheap pink fuzzy blankets have to go!) I am very impressed with the quality of this blanket. Very warm and looked great after its first wash. I ordered a king size for my full size bed, and it is long enough on all sides to work as a coverlet for a more formal look in the summer, once it gets too warm for a duvet. I am already considering ordering another to use as a sofa cover for my animals.
customer_reviews.author: Saki Munki

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Living in Florida, where temperatures fluctuate, this is the perfect blanket. It's cool, yet warm (don't ask me to explain that, it just is). I washed the blanket before I used it and it laundered beautifully. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DeeR

customer_reviews.title: Not waking up hot any more.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for summer cover. We were getting hot at night with our bed comforter and just use this blanket and sheet at night now. I am not waking up hot since we started using this cover. In fact , I was cold when we started using this cover and had to turn air up a couple of degrees. So saving on electricity now. It is light weight and durable. Has washed and dried well too.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie Garner

customer_reviews.title: summer blanket
customer_reviews.text: the weather is warming up and I needed a new blanket to sleep in. got this lovely pastel green color and it's very light. it had a bit of a "factory" smell though, so I had to put it through the wash before using. it's also not the softest feel (since it's a patterned fabric) which was fine because I use a flat sheet under it anyways. overall it's good and fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what a cotton layering blanket should be!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. It's just the right weight, softness, and size. As other reviewers have noted, be sure you know what you want. This is not plush softness nor is it meant to be. This is a perfect layering blanket for colder weather. I gave 5 stars on softness as it meets the softness levels for this type of blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Unusual but practical flat-woven checkerboard pattern- resists cat-claw pulls
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a summer lightweight cotton thermal blanket in a darker color (not white or pastel) to go with my dark-patterned bedding set. Very pleased with this color (deep purple) - it was exactly as depicted. Also, this brand has an unusual flat-woven pattern- it’s a checkerboard of squares alternating tightly flat-woven yarn and a slightly open waffle-weave thermal pattern. My housemate immediately commented than the tighter, flatter weave would make it better for resisting accidental claw- pulling by cats (unlike traditional open-weave thermal, where cats can easily get their claws caught). So the rich color plus cat-resistant weave makes it a win-win for my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Lazzaro

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL COTTON BLANKET
customer_reviews.text: I am so very pleased with the quality, color and weight of the Utopia cotton blanket I recently purchased. The weave is tight and did not pill, "fuzz" or degrade at all after machine washing and drying. The color is beautiful and the size is as advertised. I use this king-size blanket as a spread on my queen-size bed, supplemented by a down comforter folded at the foot of the bed that I can just pull up on a really cold night. It works perfectly!!! I would totally recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ANONYMOUS

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: It's quite a bit lighter than I expected. A perfect, stuffy, warm afternoon blanket, but you'll probably need another one or more on top for winter. It is a bit rough right out of the package, but I got used to it and now it's my bed blanket. 4-5 good washes with a heaping amount of fabric softener do it wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Light blanket for warm nights
customer_reviews.text: I live in a climate where it is warm for much of the year so it is necessary to have come light sheets and blankets to sleep comfortably. Initially. I was skeptical this blanket would provide the breathe-ability needed to sleep without overheating at night. After a few weeks of sleeping with this blanket, I can say this allowed me to rest comfortably. A few caveats. First, I ordered a Full/Queen size blanket and it was a little longer than I would like but it does not ruin the product. Second, the fabric can be course though I imagine it requires a 'breaking-in' period and a few washes before it gets softer.
customer_reviews.author: sir aqualeaf

customer_reviews.title: Prefect summer blanket!
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted to try a light cotton blanket as I run at quite a high temperature, even while resting. Combine that with the hot environment I live in and it makes for some very restless nights trying to get comfortable. I am also someone who struggles to sleep without a little weight on top of them, and this thing solved all my problems. It breathes so good, and I can actually feel air blowing through it. Love this product so much. I'm glad I took a chance on it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, lightweight bed cover for summer
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes in summer you still need a blanket, just not a 25 pound quilt. This blanket fits the bill. We're using it on our bed. On cooler nights it's spread over the bed; on warmer nights it's folded over a chair. Not too heavy. Did not pill when washed, and did not notice any excessive shrinking. I am thinking of buying another one for the guest room
customer_reviews.author: Elsie Whittle

customer_reviews.title: I've never even understood why someone would sell a person garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst blanket I've ever had. I had so many things to choose from and I got this piece of garbage in the mail. I am so upset about it because I had company coming. I washed it twice and cold water, dried it on permanent press. It literally does not fit my bed at all. I ordered a king size it looks like it will fit a twin size bed.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight blanket.
customer_reviews.text: It's not especially soft, but that's not why I bought it. The roughness has improved with use/washing as well. It makes for a great lightweight blanket that doesn't keep you too hot. I often sweat at night where most do not, and this blanket really helps. I bought this instead of a weighted cooling blanket, due to the fact that increased weight on my leg causes nerve pain. For anyone looking at an alternative...this is about the best I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend if you need a lightweight blanket for summer.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these blankets. I use them year round because I tend to get hot when sleeping. They are lightweight and comfortable. The ONLY reason I did not give 5 stars is because I do wish they were made with a softer material (and that is me being an incredibly tough critic). With that said- the material it is made out of is not bad at all. It is soft and it is comfortable. I have one in purple, one in gray, and will probably purchase one or two more.
customer_reviews.author: K.Jo Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for summer for use with a mattress topper
customer_reviews.text: Although it could be a little softer this definitely works well for my needs. I had purchased a "cooling" mattress topper a while back and, wow, do those hold heat. So after trying many different things I decided to go with a more breathable, thin blanket. This is exactly what I was looking for and it works very well. No more waking up hot anymore, it is breathable enough to let the heat out of the topper, yet not loosely woven at all so you don't get too cold from a fan blowing on you. I still sleep with a sheet as well and the blanket still releases all the heat. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: The perfect blanket
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made and the perfect weight for me since I sleep hot and feel overheated under most blankets. The construction is wonderful and sturdy since I have dogs and their nails generally snag cotton blankets. Doesn't happen with this blanket. I just ordered another one because, as I said, it's the perfect blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, I think it's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing negative to say about this blanket. Considering ordering another one for my mother. The blanket is not too light, not too heavy. It soft and not stiff at all. The checker pattern is a nice touch, but the thing I like most it the color. I'm so glad the dark grey was an option besides basic white. It looks and feels very nice. It does keep you surprisingly warm for how thin it is. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: k'la
